content.question: The graph of the trigonometric function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above for <math alttext="a, less than or equal to x, less than or equal to b" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. At which of the following points on the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> could the instantaneous rate of change of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> equal the average rate of change of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, a, comma b, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 2.3: Estimating Derivatives of a Function at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
